page.title: 13Borough Hill Farm
page.content:
Borough Hill Farm is owned, worked and farmed by Mrs. Barbara Clutton. The farm has been there for about 300 years and there are a few buildings there, such as cattle and sheep sheds and the farm house. The farm stands on high ground and one spot is about 700 feet up. Also the farm's acreage is approx. 400. The farm a stock and sheep farm, lamb and beef are sold. There are four workers on the farm and their jobs are driving the tractors and looking after the animals. The machinery they have got are tractors, a muck spreader, a sprayer and a hay maker. The sheep there are usually between 4 and 8 months old when they are sold at Banbury or Northampton market. They are usually sold between June and October.
(cont p14)
